title: Presidential Waiver of Statutory Requirements Pursuant to Section 303 of the Defense Production Act of 1950: Reviving the Manufacturing and Defense Industrial Base for Munitions and Minerals
summary: The document titled "Presidential Waiver of Statutory Requirements Pursuant to Section 303 of the Defense Production Act of 1950" outlines a memorandum issued by the President on May 23, 2025. It emphasizes the necessity to enhance the production capacity of munitions, missiles, and critical minerals due to identified shortfalls that could jeopardize national defense capabilities. The memorandum grants a waiver for certain statutory requirements related to supply chains associated with these areas, specifically addressing munitions, missiles, and critical minerals, including uranium, copper, potash, and gold. The overarching goal is to ensure a robust and sustainable domestic industrial base, which is deemed essential for national security and the protection of critical infrastructure. The memorandum is directed to be published in the Federal Register.
